author: Vikas Vasudeva
text:
Home Minister Rajnath Singh on Wednesday denied any lapse by the Union and the State governments in handling the protests for reservation by Jats in Haryana.

“I don’t think there have been any lapses on the part of the State and Central governments with regard to the Jat reservation agitation,” said Mr. Singh in the Rajya Sabha. In a reply to supplementary questions, Mr. Singh said that an advisory was issued on February 19, after having shared intelligence inputs with the State government.

Mr. Singh said the State government was in talks with community leaders in a bid to find an amicable solution. However, violence broke out after an incident where three people lost their lives as the BSF had to resort to firing to control the situation.

He asked the members to wait for the report of the inquiry commission headed by the former Director-General of Police Prakash Singh to investigate the incidents during the stir.

Meanwhile, Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar said that if needed, a judicial inquiry could be instituted.
title: Rajnath denies lapse in handling Jat agitation
